intro: Brassica rapa var. xanthocona, commonly known as the yellow Chinese cabbage, is a cultivar of the mustard family (Brassicaceae) characterized by its vibrant yellow leaves. It is typically an annual or biennial plant, growing to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which are followed by pods containing several seeds. It thrives in cool climates and is often cultivated for its edible leaves and roots. This variety is valued for its nutritional content and adaptability to various soil types.
